author: Michael J Kavanagh
description: Foreign Ministers from Rwanda and Democratic Republic of Congo will sign a peace agreement June 27 in an attempt to end conflicts between the two nations that have persisted for decades, the US State Department said Wednesday.
title: US Says Rwanda and Congo Will Sign Peace Agreement on June 27

author: Olivia Fletcher
description: Ireland’s central bank revised down its economic outlook for the second time in a row as heightened geopolitical uncertainty weighs on the small, open economy.
title: Irish Central Bank Cuts Economic Forecast Again on Heightened Uncertainty

author: Tracy Withers
description: New Zealand has paused funding to the Cook Islands after the tiny South Pacific nation signed agreements with China without the expected level of consultation.
title: New Zealand Pauses Cook Islands Funding Over China Agreements

author: Akayla Gardner, Faseeh Mangi, Derek Wallbank
description: President Donald Trump met Pakistan’s army chief Wednesday in Washington as the US considers supporting Israeli airstrikes on Iran, a country with a cooperative and complex relationship with the government in Islamabad.
title: Pakistan Army Chief Discusses Israel-Iran Conflict With Trump

author: Oscar Medina
description: One of Colombia’s highest courts blocked President Gustavo Petro’s proposal to hold a referendum on boosting labor rights.
title: Colombian High Court Blocks Petro’s Referendum on Labor Rights

author: Greg Stohr
description: President Donald Trump’s administration urged the US Supreme Court to turn away a request for fast-track review of his sweeping tariffs, saying the justices should give lower courts more time to weigh in.
title: Trump Tells Supreme Court No Need to Rush to Consider Tariffs

author: Ryan Chua
description: The US State Department has ordered a review of student visa applicants’ social media presence and told them to make their profiles public, stepping up measures to restrict foreign nationals’ entry to American campuses over national security concerns.
title: US Orders Social Media Vetting for Student Visa Applicants

author: Erik Wasson, Erin Durkin, Steven T. Dennis
description: Senate Republicans are crafting provisions to provide funding for struggling rural hospitals in order to resolve an impasse on Medicaid changes that is one issue holding up passage of President Donald Trump’s tax-cut bill.
title: Senate Republicans Float Rural Hospital Fund to Ease Impasse Over Tax Bill

author: Miranda Davis
description: Chicago gave its police chief the green light to enforce temporary curfews for minors in a bid to curb violence that has typically ramped up during the summer months.
title: Chicago Empowers Police to Impose Snap Summer Curfews for Minors

author: Gregory Korte, Daniel Flatley
description: The Social Security trust fund will become unable to pay scheduled benefits to retirees and the disabled as soon as 2034, new projections show — one year earlier than last year’s estimates.
title: Social Security Warns of 23% Benefit Cut by 2034 Without a Fix

author: Joe Sobczyk
description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the rift among Trump supporters over what to do about Iran. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Trump Sees His MAGA Base Dividing Over Iran

author: Andrea Dudik
description: The Czech government survived a confidence vote initiated by the opposition over a Bitcoin scandal, shouldering through the turmoil ahead of a parliamentary election scheduled for October.
title: Czech Government Wins Confidence Vote Months Ahead of Election

author: Mario Parker, Jamie Tarabay, Nancy Cook
description: Donald Trump’s hints that he may dispatch the US military to help Israel destroy Iran’s nuclear program has spurred a revolt from his typically faithful America First base, further dividing a party already struggling to unite around the president’s second-term agenda.
title: Trump’s Iran War Talk Is Testing His Ties With MAGA Loyalists

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: On this episode of Trumponomics, we discuss how Israel’s surprise attack on Iran and the resulting war aren’t having the expected effects on energy markets.
title: Why Oil Prices Are Decoupling From Geopolitical Threats

author: Michael Nienaber, Kamil Kowalcze
description: Chancellor Friedrich Merz said he’s confident Germany’s regional governments will back his €46 billion ($53 billion) package of tax breaks after progress toward settling a dispute over sharing the cost.
title: Merz Upbeat on State Backing for €46 Billion Tax-Break Package

author: Patrick Gillespie
description: Former President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner started her first full day of house arrest wondering what she can actually do at her home in Argentina’s capital for the next six years.
title: Kirchner Begins Her House Arrest: ‘Can I Go Out to My Balcony or Not?’

author: Gerry Smith, Damian Garde
description: A panel of key government advisers appointed by Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. will weigh in on an infrequently used vaccine preservative that has been wrongly linked to autism in the past.
title: RFK Jr.’s Vaccine Panel to Vote on Flu Shots With Mercury

author: Thomas Gualtieri
description: Spanish power grid operator Red Electrica said it managed the network properly on the day of the nationwide blackout in April, clashing with the government’s opinion about the causes of the incident.
title: Spanish Grid Denies Network Mismanagement on Day of Blackout

author: Marissa Newman
description: Iran’s missile and drone attacks on Israel appear to be subsiding, prompting Israeli authorities to relax some safety restrictions.
title: Iran’s Missile Attacks Wane, Allowing Israel to Start Reopening

author: Zoltan Simon
description: A senior minister said Hungary’s police have the right to ban a Pride parade scheduled later this month, in response to an attempt by Budapest’s mayor to organize it under the capital’s auspices.
title: Police Have Right to Ban Budapest Pride Event, Minister Says

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: The second-largest party in Thai Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra’s government quit the ruling coalition, a major setback for the leader facing calls for resignation for blaming her own military for escalating a border dispute with neighbor Cambodia.
title: Thai Conservative Party Quits Ruling Coalition in Blow to PM

author: Greg Stohr
description: A divided US Supreme Court upheld a Tennessee law that outlaws certain controversial medical treatments for transgender children in a ruling that buttresses similar measures in two dozen states.
title: Supreme Court Upholds Curbs on Care for Transgender Minors

author: Catherine Lucey
description: President Donald Trump declined to say whether the US plans to join Israel’s military offensive on Iran, and said Tehran had reached out about the possibility of negotiations.
title: Trump Refuses to Reveal US Plans for Iran, Says ‘Late’ for Talks

author: Elizabeth Rembert, Amanda Albright, Simone Foxman
description: The Trump administration is privately considering unleashing what advocates and critics agree would be one of its biggest cudgels yet to pressure colleges to end slews of programs and practices benefiting students who are racial minorities.
title: Colleges Face Major Tax Blow in Trump’s Proposed IRS Rules on Race

author: Ari Natter
description: In the weeks before the House of Representative’s vote to gut clean energy tax credits in President Donald Trump’s sweeping tax and spending bill, Virginia Congresswoman Jen Kiggans cast herself as the leading Republican champion of renewables.
title: Republican Who Flip-Flopped on Energy Credits Risks Voters’ Ire

author: Andreina Itriago, Patricia Laya, Andrea Jaramillo
description: One of Venezuela’s most valuable overseas assets is set to lose its license to operate in Colombia as part of a US attack on the finances of the Nicolas Maduro regime.
title: Fertilizer Plant Set to Lose License as Trump Squeezes Venezuela

author: Jonathan Tirone, Annmarie Hordern
description: The United Nations nuclear watchdog said the location of Iran’s near-bomb-grade stockpile of enriched uranium cannot currently be verified, as Israel’s ongoing military assault is preventing inspectors from doing their work.
title: Iran Near-Bomb-Grade Uranium’s Location Uncertain, UN Watchdog Says

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: New York Representative Mike Lawler said Wednesday he is open to negotiating with the Senate to advance President Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending bill, but insisted he would not agree to cut a $40,000 cap on state and local tax deductions, or SALT.
title: New York’s Lawler Stands Firm on $40,000 SALT Cap Deal

author: Alicia Clanton
description: The Trump administration has deployed into duty 2,000 National Guard soldiers in California, even as the state’s governor clashes with the White House over using troops to quell protests over the federal immigration crackdown.
title: Trump Activates 2,000 National Guard in Los Angeles

author: Alicia Clanton
description: The Trump administration activated 2,000 additional National Guard soldiers in California, even as the state’s governor clashes with the White House over deploying troops.
title: Trump Deploys 2,000 More National Guard Troops to Los Angeles

author: S'thembile Cele
description: South Africa will resume trade talks with the Trump administration on the sidelines of the US-Africa Business Summit next week, with less than a month to go before Washington’s reciprocal tariffs are set to come into effect.
title: South Africa, US to Resume Trade Talks as Tariff Deadline Looms

author: Marton Kasnyik
description: Hungary’s largest opposition party Tisza surged to a 15 percentage point lead over Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s governing Fidesz in an opinion poll, ahead of elections due next year.
title: Hungary’s Opposition Tisza Surges in Poll Against Orban’s Fidesz

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s prime minister blamed her own military for escalating a border dispute with Cambodia, according to a leaked audio recording, sparking fresh political turmoil in the country as opposition groups called on her to resign.
title: Thai PM Sparks Turmoil After Criticizing Army in Leaked Audio

author: Joao Lima
description: Portuguese Prime Minister Luis Montenegro’s minority government got backing from the two biggest opposition parties in a vote in parliament after his center-right coalition won a snap election in May.
title: Portugal Premier Gets Backing From Opposition in Parliament Vote

author: Golnar Motevalli, Abeer Abu Omar
description: With their economy on its knees and a weakened leadership, people in the capital don’t expect things to be the same again.
title: In Tehran, Iranians Brace for What’s Next in Unpredictable War

author: Eltaf Najafizada
description: Iran’s Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei said that his country won’t surrender to Israel after US President Donald Trump called for the Islamic Republic’s capitulation amid growing speculation that Washington could enter the conflict.
title: Khamenei Tells US That Iran Won’t Surrender to Israel

author: Julian Lee
description: Crude shipments fell to the lowest since April in the four weeks to June 15
title: Russia's Faltering Oil Flows Crimp Gains From Rally in Prices

author: Martha Viotti Beck, Simone Iglesias
description: Brazil’s government has no immediate plans to develop new fiscal measures amid setbacks in Congress, and will instead seek to persuade lawmakers against blocking proposed tax increases, according to two officials with knowledge of the situation.
title: Brazil’s Lula to Push Fiscal Plan Forward Despite Setbacks in Congress

author: Redd Brown
description: Fluoride-free toothpaste sales are jumping as Health and Human Services Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and other government officials openly question the safety of the mineral long hailed as a public-health miracle.
title: RFK Jr.’s Criticism of Fluoride Is Good News for Natural Toothpaste Brands

author: Jenni Marsh
description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: Xi, Trump Take Opposite Sides on Iran-Israel

author: Olesia Safronova
description: Ukraine’s lawmakers passed a law that allows Ukrainians to hold multiple citizenships as President Volodymyr Zelenskiy seeks to strengthen ties with the diaspora and fix a demographic crisis.
title: Ukraine’s Parliament Backs Law Allowing Multiple Citizenships

author: Mathieu Dion
description: Software company SAP SE and an IBM Corp. subsidiary are embroiled in a C$1.1 billion ($810 million) technology boondoggle that triggered both a public inquiry and an anti-corruption investigation in Quebec.
title: SAP and IBM Unit Ensnared in $800 Million Quebec IT Fiasco

author: Yongchang Chin, Serene Cheong
description: Middle Eastern oil that loads outside the Persian Gulf and at least one Malaysian grade are suddenly more popular with Asian buyers as the Israel-Iran conflict threatens to imperil the passage of vessels through the Strait of Hormuz.
title: Demand for Oil Loading Outside Persian Gulf Soars on War Risk

author: Jacob Lorinc, James Attwood, Yvonne Yue Li
description: The industry will need to overcome high energy and labor costs, environmental regulations and a glut of cheap Chinese competition to make US copper smelting great again.
title: The US Has More Copper Than China But No Way to Refine All of It

author: Greg Stohr, Zoe Tillman
description: The US Supreme Court will close out its term in the next two weeks with a trail of unfinished business, leaving in limbo the fate of many of President Donald Trump’s most sweeping uses of executive power.
title: Supreme Court Set to Leave Town With Trump Challenges Unsettled

author: James Mayger
description: China has attacked the Group of Seven nations for what it called interference in its internal affairs and chastised a top European official for criticizing Beijing’s rare earth and economic policies.
title: China Lashes Out at G-7, Von der Leyen for Criticism of Policies

author: Dan Williams
description: Israel is repatriating tens of thousands of its citizens stranded abroad after a flare-up in fighting with Iran, deploying emergency airlifts and ferries.
title: Israel Begins Repatriation of Citizens Stranded By Iran Strikes

author: Swati Gupta
description: India’s Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal will visit the United Kingdom on June 18 to discuss the progress on the implementation of the trade deal announced last month.
title: India’s Goyal to Visit UK to Discuss Trade Deal Implementation

author: Norman Harsono, Grace Sihombing
description: Indonesia’s anti graft agency has sent a letter summoning Bank Indonesia Deputy Governor Filianingsih Hendarta for questioning as a witness in a graft case related to a social program, local news outlet Technoz reported on Wednesday.
title: Indonesia to Summon BI Deputy as Witness in Graft Case: Technoz

author: Akayla Gardner, Josh Wingrove, Stephanie Lai, Arsalan Shahla
description: Iran and Israel exchanged fire for a sixth day after US President Donald Trump met with his national security team to discuss the escalating conflict, fueling fresh speculation that Washington is on the verge of joining the attacks.
title: Israel-Iran Conflict Enters Sixth Day as Trump Weighs Options

author: Swati Gupta, Prateek Mazumdar
description: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi disputed President Donald Trump’s claims that trade deals were used to clinch a ceasefire with Pakistan during last month’s military conflict.
title: Modi Pushes Back Against Trump’s Claim on Pakistan Ceasefire

author: Benjamin Stupples, Leonard Kehnscherper, Joe Mayes
description: The debate over the UK’s “non-dom” status has taken center stage yet again. The decision by Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves to end a two-century old tax break for wealthy foreigners has triggered the exit of many well-heeled residents from the country.
title: A UK Wealth Exodus? Why ‘Non-Dom’ Crackdown Risks Backfiring for Reeves

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: Thailand’s ruling party and its top coalition partner are clashing over a key ministerial post, as a looming cabinet shakeup by Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra threatens to shift alliances and unsettle the conservative establishment.
title: Thai Cabinet Rift Over Key Post Risks Shaking Ruling Coalition

author: Jenny Leonard, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: The Trump administration is pressing ahead with another tariff barrage that some trade experts say is more legally sound than the president’s country-by-country duties and may end up having an equally broad effect on imports.
title: Trump Flexes Security Powers to Keep Global Tariff Goal Alive

author: Yian Lee, Cindy Wang
description: A group of US lawmakers held a rare publicly disclosed meeting with Taiwan’s top defense official, a discussion that risks spurring China to step up its military intimidation of the democracy.
title: US Lawmakers’ Talks With Top Taiwan Official Risks Irking China

author: Hyonhee Shin
description: Kim Jong Un discussed ongoing cooperation with Moscow in talks with President Vladimir Putin’s top security aide Sergei Shoigu, North Korea’s state media said Wednesday, after reports that Pyongyang plans to send more military personnel to support Russia.
title: Putin Aide Shoigu Meets Kim as Pyongyang Plans More Military Aid

author: Sakura Murakami, Yoshiaki Nohara
description: Japan will prioritize protecting its national interests in trade talks without rushing into a deal with the US, Japanese Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba said as he wrapped up two days of meetings at the Group of Seven gathering.
title: Japan to Protect Trade Interests And Not Rush Deal, Ishiba Says

author: Oscar Medina
description: The Colombian Senate approved one of President Gustavo Petro’s key reforms to boost workers’ benefits, creating concerns among businesses that it would raise labor costs.
title: Petro Seizes Colombia Labor Reform Victory, Worrying Businesses

author: Swati Pandey
description: Expanding trade ties between Australia and the European Union would be “symbolically important” in an environment of rising protectionism, Prime Minister Anthony Albanese said Wednesday, as the two sides also plan talks on a defense agreement.
title: Australian PM Says EU Trade Deal Is ‘Symbolically Important’

author: Derek Wallbank
description: President Donald Trump will meet with Pakistan’s army chief on his first official visit to the US since intense clashes broke out earlier this year near the Pakistan-India border, ending in a US-brokered ceasefire between Islamabad and New Delhi.
title: Trump to Meet With Pakistan Army Chief at White House Wednesday

author: Donato Paolo Mancini
description: Italian Premier Giorgia Meloni sought to rally the Group of Seven leaders to support a ceasefire in Gaza, renewing the push amid an escalation of hostilities between Iran and Israel.
title: Meloni Pushes for Gaza Ceasefire at G-7 Amid Israel-Iran Crisis

author: Oscar Medina
description: Colombia’s Constitutional Court returned the government-backed pension reform to Congress, citing a procedural error in a move that offers a glimmer of hope for President Gustavo Petro, whose ambitious social reforms have faced significant hurdles in the legislature.
title: Colombia High Court Returns Petro’s Pension Bill to Congress
